Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 34th overall pick, by Pittsburgh in 1975...
Traded from Pittsburgh to Penn on 2/12/1978 (Going to PEN: RF R. Gonsalves, C C. Miller, SS C. Primeaux. Going to PIT: LF R. Doan)...
Had first career hit on 7/21/1978, off Vincent Stutts (LYN)...
Hit first career homerun on 9/25/1978, off Daron Hamlin (LP)...
Had 7 hits with 1 RBI against Capital City on 4/13/1979...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Leftfield in 1980...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Gashouse on 5/18/1981...
Signed as a free agent by Longport on 2/1/1984 to a 5-year deal worth $1,101,111 per year...
Injured on 8/17/1984 with a Jammed Finger, out for 1-2 weeks...
